summary.title: Smart Grid Threat Model
summary.description: The system is a combination of a communication, power and co simulator to simulate the power grid over middle and lower voltage.

diagrams.title: Initial Threat Analysis

data.name: SMGW
data.description: Erfasst Zaehlerdaten, verpackt sie als InfoReports und steuert ueber ControlMessages Hausanschlussgeraete

data.name: VNB-SCADA
data.description: Leitsystem des Verteilnetzbetreibers fuer Smart-Meter-Daten und CLS-Steuerung (Load-/Generation-Commands)

data.name: Control Message
data.description: TargetPower/LoadReduction

threats.title: Communication Protocol Downgrade
threats.description: Forcing systems to use weaker communication protocols
threats.mitigation:
- Only allow secure, up-to-date protocols (e.g., TLS 1.3)
- Use nonces/timestamps to prevent replay
- Disable legacy/weak protocol support

threats.title: Timestamp Tampering
threats.description: Affecting coordination between protection systems and control centers
threats.mitigation:
- Use authenticated time sources
- Redundant time synchronization mechanisms
- Monitor for anomalies in time data

threats.title: DoS
threats.description: Flooding critical communication channels, especially affecting real-time control systems
threats.mitigation:
- Rate limiting and traffic filtering
- Redundant network paths and failover
- DDoS mitigation appliances/services

threats.title: Man-in-the-Middle
threats.description: Intercepting and modifying communications between control centers and field devices
threats.mitigation:
- Mutual authentication (certificates)
- Regular protocol and certificate audits

threats.title: Traffic Analysis
threats.description: Inferring operational patterns and vulnerabilities through network traffic observation
threats.mitigation:
- Use strong encryption (TLS/IPsec) for all data in transit
- Regular key rotation and management

threats.title: Exploit Vulnerable Protocols
threats.description: Exploiting vulnerabilities in DNP3, IEC 61850, and other industrial protocols
threats.mitigation:
- Only allow secure, up-to-date protocols (e.g., TLS 1.3)
- Disable legacy/weak protocol support

threats.title: Man-in-the-Middle
threats.description: Intercepting certificate validation traffic to enable impersonation attacks
threats.mitigation:
- Enforce certificate pinning and strict TLS validation
- Use HSTS and OCSP stapling

data.name: InfoReport
data.description: TAC-Container

threats.title: False Data Injection
threats.description: Manipulating sensor readings from PMUs and Protected-IEDs to cause incorrect state estimation
threats.mitigation:
- End-to-end encryption and digital signatures on all data flows
- Anomaly detection and cross-validation with redundant data sources

threats.title: Blind Security Monitoring
threats.description: Attackers may attempt to blind security monitoring systems to avoid detection during attacks
threats.mitigation:
- Secure log storage (write-once, cryptographically signed)
- Deploy redundant monitoring
- Use anomaly detection and regular log audits

threats.title: Falsifying Log
threats.description: Falsifying security event logs to cover attack traces
threats.mitigation:
- Secure log storage (write-once, cryptographically signed)
- Deploy redundant monitoring
- Use anomaly detection and regular log audits

threats.title: Protection System Bypass
threats.description: Disabling or manipulating protective relays and monitoring systems
threats.mitigation:
- Strong authentication (MFA, certificates)
- Role-based access control (RBAC)
- Input validation and whitelisting

threats.title: OCSP Responder Compromise
threats.description: Attackers can manipulate certificate validation responses, to allow them to revoke certificates to appear valid
threats.mitigation:
- Use of strong mutual TLS authentication for all PKI communications
- Harden and isolate PKI servers
- Regularly auditing and monitoring of certificate status and PKI integrity

threats.title: Backdoored Firmware in Protection-IEDs
threats.description: Backdoored firmware in field devices (e.g., smart meters or protection relays) enables persistent access.
threats.mitigation:
- Vendor Risk Assesment
- Code Signing & Verification
- Secure Boot
- Ongoing Code Scanning
- Zero Trust Supply Chain Model
- Track and Trace

threats.title: Microgrid Compromise
threats.description: Manipulation of local energy management and control systems
threats.mitigation:
- Secure boot, hardware security modules, and firmware integrity checks
- Regular vulnerability scanning and patch management
- Physical security controls

data.name: Control
data.description: Operate and Target Power als CLS-JSON

threats.title: DER-Gateway Exploitation
threats.description: Distributed Energy Resource control manipulation to destabilize grid operations
threats.mitigation:
- Secure boot, hardware security modules, and firmware integrity checks
- Regular vulnerability scanning and patch management
- Physical security controls

threats.title: Replay Attack
threats.description: Replaying legitimate control commands at inappropriate times
threats.mitigation:
- Only allow secure, up-to-date protocols (e.g., TLS 1.3)
- Use nonces/timestamps to prevent replay
- Disable legacy/weak protocol support

threats.title: Command Injection
threats.description: Inserting malicious control commands into legitimate communication streams
threats.mitigation:
- Strong authentication (MFA, certificates)
- Role-based access control (RBAC)
- Input validation and whitelisting

threats.title: DDoS
threats.description: Coordinated attacks against multiple communication nodes simultaneously
threats.mitigation:
- Rate limiting and traffic filtering
- Redundant network paths and failover
- DDoS mitigation appliances/services

threats.title: Fingerprinting
threats.description:
See OWASP Automated Threat #4:
Specific requests are sent to the application eliciting information in order to profile the application
threats.mitigation: Defence includes restricting what information is provided, for example version numbers and package details

threats.title: Exploit Vulnerable Protocols
threats.description: Exploiting vulnerabilities in DNP3, IEC 61850, and other industrial protocols
threats.mitigation:
- Only allow secure, up-to-date protocols (e.g., TLS 1.3)
- Disable legacy/weak protocol support

threats.description: Intercepting certificate validation traffic to enable impersonation attacks
threats.mitigation:
- Enforce certificate pinning and strict TLS validation
- Use HSTS and OCSP stapling

threats.title: Unauthorized Voltage Setpoint Change
threats.description: Adversaries manipulate voltage setpoints in real-time via compromised micro-controllers, causing equipment damage or cascading outages.
threats.mitigation:
- Role-based access control
- Strong Authentication (MFA)
- Command Validation
- Anomaly detection
- End-to-End encryption (TLS 1.3)

data.name: Outage Management System
data.description: System fuer Ausfallermittlung: Polling von Smart Meter Gateways (ANSI C12.22/DLMS) und Auswerten von Responses

data.name: IDS/SIEM
data.description: Empfaengt IDS-Alarme via Syslog, korreliert Security-Events und priorisiert Vorfaelle fuer das Security Operation Center

data.name: CRL-Server
data.description: Stellt Certificate Revocation List (CRLs) bereit, damit Clients Zertifikats gueltigkeit pruefen koennen.

threats.title: CRL-Server Compromise
threats.description: Certificate Revocation List tampering can enable the use of compromised certificates
threats.mitigation:
- Use of strong mutual TLS authentication for all PKI communications
- Harden and isolate PKI servers
- Regularly auditing and monitoring of certificate status and PKI integrity

data.name: OCSP-Responder
data.description: On-Line Certificate Status Protocol: gibt in Echtzeit den Wiederrufstatus von X.509-Zertifikaten aus.

data.name: PMU
data.description: Messen von Phasorgroessen (U/I, Frequenz, ROCOF) mit PTP-Zeitstempel und Streaming an WAMS

threats.title: GPS Spoofing
threats.description: Disrupting phasor measurement timing, causing false fault detection and potential line disconnections
threats.mitigation:
- Use authenticated time sources
- Redundant time synchronization mechanisms
- Monitor for anomalies in time data

data.name: WAMS-Backend
data.description: Phasordaten-Konzentrator und Analyseplattform fuer Wide-Area Monitoring & Protection (WAMPAC, State Estimation)

data.name: DSO-DMS
data.description: Distribution Management System: Netzueberwachung, Lastfluss- und Spannungsregelung, FLISR-Funktionen

data.name: Protected-IED
data.description: Schutzrelais fuer Distanzschutz, Differentialschutz, trippt und isoliert fehlerhafte Netzzonen via GOOSE

data.name: Operator UI
data.description: Dies ist das Grid-Operator-Dashboard, wodurch der Operator mit dem System interagieren kann.

threats.title: Social Engineering
threats.description: Targeting operational personnel with access to critical systems
threats.mitigation:
- Security Trainings
- Quick reaction to security attacks
- Multi-factor authentication
- RBAC with least privilege
- Audit trails and behavioral monitoring

threats.title: Privileged Access Abuse
threats.description: Legitimate users with cross-boundary access conducting malicious activities
threats.mitigation:
- Multi-factor authentication
- RBAC with least privilege
- Audit trails and behavioral monitoring

data.name: DER-Gateway
data.description: Schnittstelle zu dezentralen Erzeugungs- bzw. Speicheranlagen fuer Setpoints (P/Q) und Telemetrie (ACK, Status)

data.name: VPP Operator
data.description: Virtuelles Kraftwerks-Management: Registrierung/Deregistrierung, Aggergation von Forecasts und Schedules

threats.title: VPP Operator Compromise
threats.description: Virtual Power Plant systems being used as attack vectors into utility networks
threats.mitigation:
- Network segmentation and strict inter-domain access controls
- Continuous monitoring of inter-domain traffic
- Security vetting of third-party components

data.name: Microgrid Controller
data.description: Bedienoberflaeche und Steuerungsebene fuer grid-connected Microgrids; zeigt MMS-Reports und sendet Dispatch-Befehle

data.name: EVSE-Gateway
data.description: Schnittstelle zu Ladestationen: V2G-Setpoints (ISO 15118), Messwerte (IEC 63110) und Lade-ACKs

threats.title: Third Party Integration
threats.description: Vulnerabilities in external operator connections becoming entry points
threats.mitigation:
- Network segmentation and strict inter-domain access controls
- Continuous monitoring of inter-domain traffic
- Security vetting of third-party components

threats.title: Supply Chain Attack
threats.description: Compromised components introduced through different organizational domains
threats.mitigation:
- Vendor risk assessments
- Secure software/firmware supply chain
- Code signing and verification

diagrams.description: This is used as the initial threat analysis which is high level and will be ported to Threagile for a deeper analysis in the future.
